later in the pattern and divide colors into row accordingly for smaller sizes yarn fingering weight yarn in the colors of your choice the amount depends on which flag you re doing but it doesn t take much since the garment is quite small the examples shown are in knitpicks palette see the end of the pattern for a list of specific colors for different pride flags using this yarn tools  16-inch circular knitting needle size us 3 or 4  double pointed knitting needles in same size or circular needle of appropriate length for magic loop  tapestry needle  bowl or head mold for blocking instructions striping the width of stripes depends on which flag you are making see the list of flags at the end for how many row to use for each color cast on 114 stitches using the circular needle set a stitch marker at the beginning of the row if needed work the pattern in the round as follows changing to double pointed needles or magic loop when necessary  row 1 knit  row 2 purl  row 3
